faqs.question: What is the dress code?
faqs.answer: Tropical Formal. We invite you to dress elegantly yet comfortably. We recommend long or midi dresses in light, airy fabrics, linen or light-colored suits for men, and comfortable shoes such as wedges, elegant sandals, or block heels (avoid stilettos due to the sand). Please avoid wearing beige, blue, light blue, or turquoise, as these are reserved for the guests of honor. White is reserved for the bride.

faqs.question: What time should I arrive?
faqs.answer: Doors open at 3:20 PM. The ceremony starts promptly at 4:00 PM.

faqs.question: Where is the event?
faqs.answer: At Mi Casita Tica, Puntarenas. You can find the map link under Info.

faqs.question: What happens if I don‚Äôt RSVP?
faqs.answer: Only those who confirmed will be allowed entry. We‚Äôre personalizing every detail and have made payments per guest, so we won‚Äôt be able to accommodate unconfirmed attendees. If you don‚Äôt RSVP, we‚Äôll understand you won‚Äôt be joining us.

faqs.question: Can I bring a plus one?
faqs.answer: Only if they were included in your invitation. The wedding has limited capacity, so we kindly ask that only confirmed and registered guests attend.

faqs.question: Will parking be available?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is space to park inside and near the venue. We recommend arriving early.

faqs.question: Is there transportation from any location?
faqs.answer: We are not providing transportation, but guests can coordinate in groups. We‚Äôll share a contact list to help organize carpools if needed.

faqs.question: What if it rains?
faqs.answer: The ceremony will be outdoors, but the party will be under a roof. February is dry season, so we expect good weather, but if it rains, everything will move indoors. The party goes on!

faqs.question: Are there any activities the next day?
faqs.answer: We don‚Äôt have activities planned for the next day. That‚Äôs why we suggest you stay somewhere you‚Äôll enjoy that‚Äôs close to local attractions like Paseo de los Turistas, Marine Park, nearby beaches, the port pier, San Lucas Island, Tortuga Island, and more. You can also choose a hotel or house with a pool and amenities to make the wedding weekend a getaway of its own.
